group.name: Reef Fish
group.description: Colorful bony fish associated with coral reefs.

entries.name: Doubleheader Wrasse
entries.description: The doubleheader wrasse is a large, rare wrasse found in subtropical reefs of eastern Australia, notable for its bulbous forehead in males.

entries.name: Ballina Angelfish
entries.description: The Ballina angelfish is a rare, striking angelfish endemic to deep reefs off eastern Australia, recognized by its bold black and white pattern.

entries.name: California Sheephead
entries.description: The California sheephead is a wrasse native to the eastern Pacific, known for its dramatic color change and sequential hermaphroditism.

entries.name: Goliath Grouper
entries.description: The goliath grouper is one of the largest reef fish, found in the Atlantic and eastern Pacific, known for its massive size and booming sounds.

entries.name: Giant Black Sea Bass
entries.description: The giant black sea bass is a massive, long-lived reef fish native to the eastern Pacific, known for its size and recovery from overfishing.

entries.name: Rockfish
entries.description: Rockfish are a diverse group of spiny-finned fish found in rocky reefs, especially in the Pacific, known for their longevity and variety of colors.

entries.name: Frogfish
entries.description: Frogfish are masters of camouflage, using a lure to attract prey and blending perfectly with sponges and corals on the reef.

entries.name: Garibaldi
entries.description: The Garibaldi is a bright orange damselfish, California's state marine fish, known for its bold color and territorial nature.

entries.name: Seahorse
entries.description: Seahorses are small, upright-swimming fish known for their horse-like head, prehensile tail, and unique reproductive behavior where males carry the eggs.

entries.name: Sardine
entries.description: Sardines are small, silvery, schooling fish found in large numbers in coastal waters, important as prey for many marine predators.
